--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Josh Knowles" <josh.knowles@w...> wrote:
> Not only have the logo on the website but what about putting in custom
> JavaDoc tags which point at the JUnit test methods.

To quote from HHGG: "Oh no!  Not again!"

Having tags like that would promote the idea that you test methods. 
Even that you have test-methods that test production-methods and
test-classes that test production-classes.

You don't want to test methods, you want to test behaviour (which, of
course, is done by calling methods).

That's not the way to use JUnit.  TestCase subclasses are for
packagine a test fixture and the tests that run in the context of that
fixture, not for collecting tests that test a spcecific class.

That may not be what you meant, but that's what it sounded like.

Dave
